newsitem.title: KENYA: Power firm lifts Nairobi bourse index.
newsitem.headline: Power firm lifts Nairobi bourse index.

text.p: A deal for power monopoly Kenya Power & Lighting helped to lift the Nairobi Stock Exchange 20-share index marginally on Thursday.
The index gained 16.43 points to close at 3327.35 points.
Turnover was 22.860 million shillings on 438,270 shares compared to 28.034 million shillings on 568,161 shares on Wednesday.
"Prices today recovered marginally from last week's dips," a bourse official said.
A total of 57,200 Kenya Power shares were dealt at a reserve price of 120.00 from 117.00 on the one-hour special board.
Brokers said a lot of the optimism surrounding the share was centred on the intended separation of the power generation and supply functions of the firm.
"It is bound to reduce operating costs," one dealer said.
Foreign interest in Kakuzi, Kenya Commercial Bank and Sasini Tea & Coffee remained -- holding prices stable.
Kakuzi closed at 101.00 unchanged, while Sasini Tea & Coffee eased to 76.00 from 77.00. Kenya Commercial Bank closed at 95.00 from 96.00.
Standard Chartered Bank eased to 46.00 from 46.25 while Uchumi Supermarket edged to 37.00 from 36.50.
Rea Vipingo Plantations was unchanged at 9.00 while Total Kenya shed a shilling to close at 62.50.
Barclays Bank was unchanged at 100.00 while National Bank of Kenya closed at 15.60 from 15.55.
